body:
please reopen in the mirall repo.
thx


von samsung mobile gesendetandredasilvapinto <notifications@github.com> hat geschrieben:i had a folder with almost 9 gb that i started uploading 11 days ago. right now only 2 gb were uploaded.

i'm also getting a "csync update failed" error on the client application.
i've identified some problems with the files' timestamps on the origin computer (timestamps in the future), so i've run the client with the --logwindow option to get the debug log and this is the kind of messages i'm receiving:

    12-09 17:51:43:543 root - local file mtime: 1295951597
    12-09 17:51:43:553 csync.vio.main - win32: stat-inode for d:/path/092ctb04.d11: 911896
    12-09 17:51:43:563 csync.updater - uniq id read from database: path/092ctb04.d11 -> <null>
    12-09 17:51:43:573 csync.updater - walk: d:/path/092ctb04.d11
    12-09 17:51:43:593 csync.updater - file: d:/path/092ctb04.d11
    12-09 17:51:43:603 csync.updater - file: path/092ctb04.d11 - hash 10190901493053667456, mtime: 1295951597
    12-09 17:51:43:613 csync.statedb - no result record found for phash = 10190901493053667456
    12-09 17:51:43:623 csync.updater - file: path/092ctb04.d11, instruction: instruction_new
    12-09 17:51:43:683 root - local file mtime: 1295951597
    12-09 17:51:43:693 csync.vio.main - win32: stat-inode for d:/path/092ctb05.d11: 911897
    12-09 17:51:43:713 csync.updater - uniq id read from database: path/092ctb05.d11 -> <null>
    12-09 17:51:43:723 csync.updater - walk: d:/path/092ctb05.d11
    12-09 17:51:43:733 csync.updater - file: d:/path/092ctb05.d11
    12-09 17:51:43:753 csync.updater - file: path/092ctb05.d11 - hash 15670639357489869976, mtime: 1295951597
    12-09 17:51:43:763 csync.statedb - no result record found for phash = 15670639357489869976
    12-09 17:51:43:773 csync.updater - file: path/092ctb05.d11, instruction: instruction_new
the debug log keeps being updated with similar messages about other files but on the server there are no new messages on the /var/log/apache2/ssl_access.log (i'm using ssl). there are no new messages on the error.log either.

environment: homeserver - ubuntu 12.10
server: apache/2.2.22 (ubuntu)
database: mysql ver 14.14 distrib 5.5.28, for debian-linux-gnu (i686) using readline 6.2
client: windows xp - owncloud client 1.1.3
owncloud: 4.5.4
php: 5.4.6-1ubuntu1.1

—
reply to this email directly or view it on github.

no problem! thx


von samsung mobile gesendetandredasilvapinto <notifications@github.com> hat geschrieben:sure! sorry.

—
reply to this email directly or view it on github.
